bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 106 (Monday, June 25, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 6214.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Clause 3 of section 8 of article I of the Constitution.[Page H5649]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E905-906)

summary.text:
Paul Laurence Dunbar Commemorative Coin Act

This bill directs the Department of the Treasury to mint and issue $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half-dollar clad coins in recognition and celebration of Paul Laurence Dunbar, one of the first influential African-American poets in American literature and the composer of the lyrics to In Dahomey, the first all African-American musical produced on Broadway.

All surcharges received from sales of such coins shall be paid to the Dunbar Alumni Federation.

bill.title: Paul Laurence Dunbar Commemorative Coin Act

item.title: Paul Laurence Dunbar Commemorative Coin Act
To require the Secretary of the Treasury to mint commemorative coins in recognition of Paul Laurence Dunbar.
Paul Laurence Dunbar Commemorative Coin Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
